Literature Review: The study of nuclear reprocessing tracers has significantly advanced our understanding of water circulation, mixing, ventilation, and deep-water formation in the high-latitude North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans. The release of anthropogenic radionuclides from European nuclear fuel reprocessing plants has provided a unique opportunity to investigate the transport of water masses across the ocean basin. This literature review aims to summarize the current state of knowledge on the use of nuclear reprocessing tracers to illuminate flow features and connectivity between the Arctic and subpolar North Atlantic Oceans.
